thread.title: US recognition of Jerusalem as Israel's capital evokes worldwide condemnation | Associated Press Of Pakistan
thread.title_full: US recognition of Jerusalem as Israel's capital evokes worldwide condemnation | Associated Press Of Pakistan

posts.title: US recognition of Jerusalem as Israel's capital evokes worldwide condemnation | Associated Press Of Pakistan
posts.text:
US recognition of Jerusalem as Israel’s capital evokes worldwide condemnation December 7, 2017 124 
UNITED NATIONS, Dec 7 (APP):World leaders voiced grave concern over US President Donald Trump decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israel’s capital, saying it could spark further tensions in the Middle East as Palestinians consider the city as Palestine’s capital. United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres stressed that there is no alternative to the two-state solution and that Jerusalem is an issue that must be resolved through direct negotiations between the parties.“In this moment of great anxiety, I want to make it clear, there is no alternative to the two-state solution. There is no Plan B,” Guterres told reporters at UN Headquarters in New York. Pakistan and other Islamic nations have warned that the move would be detrimental to any peace effort, a concern shared by China and Russia and many other countries. The lead-up to Trump’s announcement was peppered with warnings from world leaders that he was making a “grave mistake” that would erode if not outright collapse any broader peace plan in the Middle East. But the decision moves toward fulfilling a Trump campaign promise to relocate the embassy to Jerusalem. According to American media reports, Vice President Mike Pence pushed the change in the US policy on Jerusalem, which is supported by many evangelical Christians. Trump said Pence, who stood behind the president during the announcement, would travel to the region. Pence was “one of, if not the most, vocal advocate to the president to make the decision to, one, recognize Jerusalem, but also to ultimately move the embassy the way that he’s doing it,” a senior administration official told POLITICO, an online news service. But US Secretary of State Rex Tillerson and Defence Secretary James Mattis were both said to oppose US President Donald Trump’s approach towards Jerusalem. Multiple news outlets reported that the two officials warned Trump over US recognition of Jerusalem as the Israeli capital and relocation of the American embassy to the Israel-occupied city.“Secretary of State Rex Tillerson and Defence Secretary Jim Mattis opposed the move from Tel Aviv,” Reuters said in its report, citing US officials. The Palestinian Hamas movement declared a day of rage on Friday to protest the move. The US consulate in Jerusalem issued a security warning barring government employees and their families from personal travel in Jerusalem’s Old City or the West Bank, including Bethlehem and Jericho.“A decision such as this is both morally wrong and politically dangerous,” Yousef Munayyer, executive director of the US Campaign for Palestinian Rights, said in a statement. “Not only is Donald Trump deliberately insulting the Palestinian people, but also Arabs and Muslims around the world. In doing so, he is relinquishing what little credibility the United States had left in a region that is already rife with conflict and division.” Egypt’s President Abdel Fatah el-Sissi on Tuesday pushed the US not to relocate the embassy and said in a statement he spoke with Trump by phone about the issue. The Saudi foreign ministry issued a statement saying the move would “provoke sentiments of Muslims throughout world.” Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, meanwhile, said the US recognizing Jerusalem as Israel’s capital would be a “red line” for Muslims. In a televised speech after Trump’s announcement, Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas said Jerusalem is the “eternal capital of the State of Palestine.” Abbas added that the US president’s speech was “tantamount to the United States abdicating its role as a peace mediator.” Meanwhile, Palestinians in the besieged Gaza Strip staged a demonstration against the US and Israel, condemning Trump’s recognition of Jerusalem as Israel’s capital. Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh said in a statement that the Palestinian people “know how to respond properly”. He added that the decision “will not change the facts of history and geography.” As many protesters have gathered outside the US consulate in Istanbul in reaction to Trump’s announcement, the Turkish Foreign Ministry denounced the speech as an “irresponsible statement.” Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu also said Trump’s recognition does not automatically make Jerusalem as the capital of Israel. Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, UK Prime Minister Theresa May, and French President Emmanuel Macron, also said that Jerusalem’s status must be resolved through direct Israeli-Palestinian negotiations. Pope Francis, who met earlier Wednesday at the Vatican with a Palestinian delegation, voiced his own opposition to the US shift in Israel, urging a continuation of “everyone’s commitment to respect the city’s status quo, in conformity with the pertinent United Nations Resolutions.“My thoughts go to Jerusalem and I cannot keep silent my deep concern for the situation that has been created in the past days,” the pope said. “I pray to the Lord that its identity is preserved and strengthened for the benefit of the Holy Land, the Middle East and the whole world and that wisdom and prudence prevail to prevent new elements of tension from being added to a global context already convulsed by so many cruel conflicts.” Within the Trump administration, some saw the warnings as overblown, according to media reports. One senior White House official compared the decision to Trump’s move to pull the US from the Paris climate pact” a move that was preceded by dire warnings but was ultimately, if grudgingly, accepted by world leaders.

posts.author: luvinzu
posts.title: Campus
posts.text:
I joined uni nine months after high school. I was 19, teetering on the brink of my 20s. I had just lost my virginity a few months earlier to an older girl in my hood. A second year in uni. She was 20. Chubby with full, succulent lips and squishy boobs. Pretty thing. Gorgeous. She said she liked my dimples and “bushy” eye brows. For me, her ass was the deal. And her brittle fingers. And her seductive languorous voice. She liked her dark skirts – which sharply contrasted her complexion – just above the knee. That got my testosterone on the over-drive. It got me randy. 
That was a short-lived union. Or rather, a short-lived infatuation.
The day before I left home, my dad called his friends to give me a pep talk. I think because being the firstborn, he had this panic attacks and he was sort of the helicopter dad for the longest time. In my teenage rebellion, I naturally resented it. {The hovering, not him inviting his friends to talk to me. That I found amusing}. So they did the classic – ‘preached’. I think the cool thing about teenage is the rebellion. Otherwise there’s no point being a teenager if you can’t rebel {he-he}. That’s why I take it easy with the teenagers around me. And they are many. Anyway, one lady told me to always picture this glass wall between me and any girl in campus because STIs were on the prowl for young men like me. I cackled, but heeded that advice nonetheless. That and many other priceless gems from that wise lot. They guided me through the tricky and sometimes treacherous campus life.
The next morning, buoyed with excitement, I rolled my loaded suitcase out my dad’s compound to go on a journey of self-discovery. In pursuit for knowledge. I went to study literature. My kid bros escorted me to the bus terminus. In my infinite discernment, I knew they were envious. They were envious because they were still in school; Rodger in high school and Shelton in primo. They were still condemned to wearing uniforms, and for Rodger, eating bad food laced with kerosene. I had emancipated myself from that shit. I was walking into a free world. A world of endless possibilities. The world was now my oyster. 
I arrived and went through the tedious – and annoying – registration process. Public universities had no portals yet. The orientation week was quite uneventful for me. 
I booked myself into some private hostel in a ‘student’s village’ outside campus because I could not stand the congested hostels in campus and their pathetic clock rooms. Heck, those freaking hostels could pass for concentration camps. I even wondered how guys got laid in such squalor and wretchedness. 
Classes began about a week later and I was bemused by how first years were socked in confusion; trouble reading their course codes and trying to find specific lecture halls. It was fun to see a guy – often times a continuing student- spotting a visibly confused fresh woman, walking right up her, confidence oozing out of his pores, and leading her where he wanted. The gold rush was at its apogee. 
There’s this morning, about a month in, when the confusion had tapered down and guys were pretty settled. I prance into the auditorium where a common unit, Fundamentals of computing, was to take place. It’s like ten minutes to seven. There’s chatter and banter as guys are settling down. Morning guys, those. A few others who don’t like talking in the morning are tucked away, buried in their phones. Few others are reading. 
I spot her. My heart throbs.
She’s neither engaged in banter, nor buried in her phone, nor reading. She’s just sitting there. Still. That piqued my interest. In this age and time, how many of us can sit still without feeling the urge to fish out our gizmos? I think there’s something about people who can just sit still without the urge to look at their phones, and yet not feel pressured to strike a conversation with the next person. I think such people are well centered. 
I walk up to her and tell her she’s lighting up that room real bad. She smiles, revealing a perfect set of snow white teeth. She has high cheekbones, and her hair is pulled back into a ponytail. Her skin is rich and flawless. She’s got this innocent look about her. I’m sold. Smitten. We stroll from the lecture room after class. I’m carrying this thick office point notebook in my left hand, my right hand deep in the pocket of my khaki pants. A small brown leather bag with a long thin strap hangs from her shoulder. Her hands are crossed on her chest, holding an A4 size note book. I pick her number. I feel like I have hit a massive jackpot. I feel like doing summersaults. But I play the nonchalant cool guy. I’m outdoing myself with presence here. {lol}. That evening I refrain myself from calling because I don’t want to come across as too eager. I want to come off as a different kind of cat, because I had just read somewhere that “showing that you’re impressed lowers your market value”. I shoot her an sms the following day at lunch time just to “check” on her. She happens close by. We link up for lunch at some café near the library. Nothing fancy. We hit it off.
To be continued…

posts.title: Get To Know More Concerning Reiki Texas Healing Method
posts.text:
By Maria Martin 

As a matter of fact, before western medication was invented, people used to have their own healing methods which were used to bring the wellbeing of a person. Some of them were based on beliefs, faith, and others on facts, evidence, and proof. One of this ancient treatment method is Reiki Texas method of treatment. It is a noninvasive alternative medicine which has its origin in Japan in the early nineteenth century.

On the other hand, the method has been welcomed and adopted by different regions and groups of people all over the world. It uses placement of hands by the practitioner which facilitates energy flow what brings about healing. This is done in a special manner as the practitioner has special skills and training that makes him able to access your internal system of energy. This access is what triggers internal natural healing.

This method has been used to address many-body problems ranging from mental, emotional, physical, psychological and spiritual issues. The main mechanism behind the therapy is energy balance. According to the professionals, this healing method has the ability to heal the body, the mind and even the spirit. Many patients suffering from different ailments have been helped by this mechanism. In fact, the method has become one of the complementary treatment performed by outpatient medical practitioners.

There various benefits that are associated with this type of treatment. First, this method is one of the most effective stress eliminating mechanism. The method plays an important role in bringing relaxation and reducing stress. Being relaxed improves sleep pattern and immune functionality as well as maintaining general body health. It is also believed to bring harmony and inner peace to an individual.

Another benefit of this therapy is emotions and mind balance. When you have regular treatments, you are likely to develop a state of being that is more relaxed, calmer and peaceful. You are also likely to benefit from mental energy balance which causes improved mental clarity and memory capacity. In addition, this method contributes a lot to the love life and characteristics of an individual.

This method is also beneficial in that it makes you get relieved of your emotional stress or sorrow. It helps one to clear grieving emotions and stress. On the other hand, the treatment offers many benefits to physical problems such as treatment of sciatica, arthritis, and pain among others. It is also effective in the treatment of asthma, premature menopause, insomnia and chronic fatigue among others.

This method also helps surgery patients in the recovery process as well as reducing side effects of various treatments. It is also used to treat illnesses that are intermediate as well as preventing development or progress of these conditions. However, the method has various limitations. First, the treatment has no formal regulation that governs it.

This therapy does not get support from western medication and that makes it not be regulated formally. It is not founded on scientific facts and proofs but on beliefs. The method does not have standardized curriculum, syllabus or training which makes the method to rely on the ability of the practitioner. It also does not have liability plans and insurance covers.




About the Author:

When you are looking for information about reiki Texas residents can come to our web pages online today. More details are available at http://www.karenwilsonhealing.com now.

thread.title_full: TASS: Sport - Seoul welcomes Moscow’s decision to allow athletes to participate in 2018 Olympic Games

posts.title: TASS: Sport - Seoul welcomes Moscow’s decision to allow athletes to participate in 2018 Olympic Games
posts.text:
Russia banned from 2018 Winter Olympics in PyeongChang 
According to the South Korean Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism, the active participation of athletes from all countries, including Russia, may help the Olympic Games become a success. The ministry pointed out that Russian athletes who would take part in the Olympics were sure to receive the same support from the South Korean government as national teams of other countries. 
On Tuesday, the International Olympic Committee (IOC) announced its decision to suspend the Russian Olympic Committee, banning the national team from participating in the 2018 Olympic Games in South Korea. The IOC accused Russia of systematic violations of anti-doping rules, particularly during the 2014 Sochi Olympics. At the same time, the IOC intends to respect the rights of clean athletes, allowing them to participate in the upcoming games as "Olympic Athletes of Russia." 
The Winter Olympic Games in South Korea’s Pyeongchang will be held on February 9-25, 2018. {{item.group_date}}
